channel.title: CyberNetSec - Policy and Compliance
channel.description: Latest policy and compliance threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: NY Regulator Puts Financial Firms on Notice: You Are Accountable for Your Vendors' Security
item.description:
The New York State Department of Financial Services (DFS) has issued new guidance for financial institutions, emphasizing their ultimate accountability for managing cybersecurity risks originating from third-party service providers (TPSPs). The regulator warned that as firms increasingly rely on clo...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Regulatory, Policy and Compliance, Supply Chain Attack

item.title: Healthcare Breaches Seem to Drop, But Government Shutdown Hides True Numbers
item.description:
Official data for September 2025 shows only 26 major healthcare data breaches, the lowest monthly total since 2018. However, The HIPAA Journal cautions that this apparent decline is misleading. A US government shutdown has largely halted the HHS's Office for Civil Rights (OCR) from processing and up...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

item.title: UK Regulators Issue Cyber Recovery Guide for Financial Firms
item.description:
The United Kingdom's top financial regulators—the Bank of England (BoE), the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA), and the Prudential Regulation Authority (PRA)—have jointly published a guide on effective cyber response and recovery practices. The guidance, aimed at all financial firms, emphasizes the ...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Incident Response

item.title: EU Launches Cybersecurity Reserve to Bolster Incident Response Across Member States
item.description:
The European Union has officially established the European Cybersecurity Reserve as a key component of its Cyber Solidarity Act. Managed by the EU Agency for Cybersecurity (ENISA), the reserve has a €36 million budget and consists of 45 pre-vetted, trusted private providers, such as Airbus Protect a...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Incident Response

item.title: EU and Ukraine Deepen Cyber Defense Alliance in Face of Russian Aggression
item.description:
The European Union and Ukraine have reaffirmed their strategic partnership on cybersecurity during their 4th Cyber Dialogue held in Kyiv. Against the backdrop of Russia's ongoing war, both parties committed to deepening cooperation on cyber defense, policy alignment with EU standards like the NIS2 D...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

item.title: "SIMCARTEL" CaaS Network Busted in Major European Takedown
item.description:
A coordinated international law enforcement operation codenamed "SIMCARTEL" has dismantled a massive Cybercrime-as-a-Service (CaaS) platform operating out of Latvia. The operation, involving authorities from Austria, Estonia, and Finland with support from Europol, resulted in seven arrests and the s...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Actor, Policy and Compliance

item.title: Panera Bread Reaches $2.5M Settlement for 2024 Data Breach
item.description:
Panera Bread has agreed to a $2.5 million settlement to resolve a class-action lawsuit related to a data breach that occurred in March 2024. The breach exposed the personal information, including names and Social Security numbers, of approximately 147,321 individuals, primarily current and former em...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

item.title: Deloitte to Pay $6.3M in Settlement for Rhode Island Data Breach Affecting 640,000
item.description:
Deloitte has agreed to a proposed $6.3 million class-action settlement related to a 2024 cyberattack that compromised the personal data of 640,000 Rhode Island residents—nearly half the state's population. The breach affected the state's 'RIBridges' social services system, which was managed by Deloi...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: UK's NCSC Warns of 'Alarming' Rise in Cyberattacks, Doubling in Past Year
item.description:
The UK's National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) revealed in its 2025 annual review that it managed 204 "nationally significant" cyberattacks over the past year, more than double the 89 incidents from the previous year. The agency attributed the alarming surge to increasing threats from state-sponsore...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

item.title: UK Fines Capita £14M for "Preventable" 2023 Data Breach
item.description:
The UK's Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) has levied a £14 million fine against outsourcing giant Capita for significant data protection failures related to a March 2023 data breach that impacted 6.6 million people. The ICO's investigation concluded the breach was 'preventable' and heavily cr...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Regulatory, Policy and Compliance, Data Breach
